question: ハート形
sourceMnemonic:
<ja>ハート</ja> is of course "heart" and you know that <ja>形</ja> means <kanji>shape</kanji>. You've probably already figured this one out. It's <vocabulary>heart shaped</vocabulary>. 

You can add this kanji to all sorts of other things too to say "____ shaped." Give it a try!
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for the kanji portion uses the kun'yomi reading. This is kind of like the reading you already learned for <ja>形</ja> just without the <ja>ち</ja> part. And rendaku happens too, so it becomes <ja>がた</ja>. If you can remember that, you should be able to remember this reading too!
